recommendations: Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Jumping jacks, Single-leg hops, Tuck jumps for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Swing arms forward and jump off back foot., Rotate 360 degrees with legs crossed., Land on the back foot., Practice with a half turn first. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Hitch Kick is a jump in which the skater kicks the back leg forward, then lands on the front foot.. For practicing Hitch Kick as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Leg swings, High knees, Basic hop for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Kick leading leg forward., Hop on supporting leg., Kick trailing leg forward., Land on trailing leg, leading leg in front. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Fish Roll and Flop is a movement where the dancer rolls their body in a fluid motion resembling the movement of a fish, while the Flop is a contemporary dance move where the dancer falls to the ground in a sudden and dramatic manner.. For practicing Fish Roll and Flop as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Cross-body shoulder stretch: Sit or stand with your feet hip-width apart. Reach one arm across your body, using your other arm to gently pull it towards your chest. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Thread the needle stretch: Begin on your hands and knees, then thread one arm through the space between your opposite arm and knee. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Reverse table-top pose: Sit on the ground with your hands behind you and your feet on the ground. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a table-top shape with your body. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then release. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and engage your core muscles for stability., Lift right shoulder up and back., Simultaneously lift left shoulder up and forward., Move right shoulder down and forward., Move left shoulder down and back, alternating continuously. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.
